column4: I've just installed Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, because that's the CD I have for it, that was send to me by Canonical, how do I go on about upgrading from 6.06 to 7.10? sudo apt-get dist-ugrade?
shinao1 That's the problem, I don't see it in Update Manager, I've got 170 updates, to update, and none of them is dist-upgrade.
For upgrading, see the instructions at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UpgradeNotes
Thanks. I have 6.06, and I want to install 7.10, Do I have to install 6.10, 7.04 THEN 7.10? Or can't I install straight-away to 7.10?
I think you can't go straight to 7.10
How about straight to 7.04? Oh man, upgrading to 6.10, 7.04, 7.10 eats up a lot of hdd space.
not really, the older packages are purged
I think the best you can do is order the 7.10 CDs and make a fresh install
I've ordered 6.06 LTS last year, and it showed up in my doorstep last month.
OMG!
that's weird
I'll just stick with 6.06 for now, cause it's LTS after all :)
that's the best thing you could do, do you have a good internet connection?
1Mbps here.
you could download the latest version of ubuntu, it will be finished in 2 hours or less
and make a fresh install
Nah, the DVD version would take 2+ hours.
then why you don't download the .iso that fits you best?
I'll just wait for 8.04 ..
ok, whatever
yup, whatever.
